item.title: Use Lightning and Hydra to train your neural networks
item.description: TL;DR: A tutorial for training a Llama model on protein sequences from scratch with less than 500 lines of code. Deep learning research is moving at an incredible pace, and so are the tools that support rapid experimentation. In this post, we’ll explore how to combine PyTorch Lightning and Hydra to streamline the training of a deep neural network—in our case, a Llama model trained on protein sequences, which will allow for protein sequence generation via next amino acid prediction.

item.title: Software
item.description: ProteinShake ProteinShake provides one-liner imports of large scale, preprocessed protein structure tasks and datasets for various model types and frameworks. SAT SAT provides a class of simple and flexible graph transformers built upon a new self-attention mechanism, which incorporates structural information into the original self-attention by extracting a subgraph representation rooted at each node before computing the attention. SAT can leverage any existing GNN to extract the subgraph representation and systematically improve the peroformance relative to the base GNN.
